b2972ea061 fix(core): handle run-commands targets with no commands
a71a6cab40 fix(core): fix broken nx-cloud url shortening logic (#31283)
f1171191dd fix(webpack): add support for retrieving all transitive non-buildable dependencies (#31343)

b2972ea061 fix(core): handle run-commands targets with no commands

content.text:
<pr_analysis>
- The current branch `fix-no-commands` contains one commit: "fix(core): handle run-commands targets with no commands" (b2972ea061)
- There are unstaged changes in `packages/nx/src/command-line/graph/graph.ts` that improve error handling for the graph server
- The changes add proper error handling when starting the graph server, specifically handling the case when a port is already in use
- This appears to be a bug fix that improves the user experience by providing clear error messages instead of potentially crashing
- The changes wrap the `startServer` call in a try-catch block and add error handling for the 'EADDRINUSE' error case
- There's also an untracked CLAUDE.md file that should not be included in the PR
</pr_analysis>

input.command:
gh pr create --title "fix(core): improve graph server error handling" --body "$(cat <<'EOF'
## Summary
‚Ä¢ Add proper error handling when starting the graph server
‚Ä¢ Provide clear error message when port is already in use

## Test plan
- [ ] Run `nx graph` when port 4211 is already in use
- [ ] Verify clear error message is displayed instead of crash
- [ ] Test with custom port using `--port` option

ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
EOF
)"
